@Biff11 We played in Riga at the equivalent of the top of grafton street. It was a street festival type thing and was amazing
@Biff11 The best teams are generally a couple of 6'6 lads who can shoot and are athletic. You have to be physical too
The 3x3 bit that has the biggest potential is player retention at ages 16-22 when dropout is highest. It's a fun easy to play alternative.
So don't assume you'll see 5 on 5 guys just make up a team and dominate although it could happen .
One thing about the 3x3 announcement is that most top countries have full time 3x3 players and the sport is a bit different.
@YvonneCooney Certainly the most physical.
